required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Relationship Between Body Composition, Insulin Resistance and HDL Levels
clinical_study.official_title: The Independent Effect of Level of Kidney Function and Body Composition On Establishing HDL Cholesterol Levels

brief_summary.textblock: Approximately 20 million people in the United States have some form of kidney failure. People with kidney failure have an increased chance of having low levels of high density lipid (HDL), so called "good cholesterol." Patients who are overweight or obese also have low levels of HDL. The investigators are trying to find out whether causes of low HDL are the same in people who are overweight and in patients with kidney failure so that in the future doctors can better treat low HDL cholesterol levels. People with low levels of HDL are more likely to have heart attacks and strokes and are more likely to lose kidney function. This study hope to learn more about how kidney failure causes low HDL cholesterol levels.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is not a treatment or outcome trial.This is a single center cross sectional analysis of body composition and lipoprotein level and structure among patients with graded levels of renal failure in comparison to control subjects. To study the relationship between HDL cholesterol and both body composition and insulin resistance measured as homeostatic model assessment (HOMA) among a cohort of non diabetic non-proteinuric patients with advanced chronic kidney disease (CKD) compared to non diabetic subjects having normal kidney function. Renal patients chosen will be with advanced CKD stage 3, Stage 4, and stage 5 - which is end stage renal failure (ESRD) and on hemodialysis. Fasting blood will be taken for the evaluation of baseline lipid and renal function, and blood glucose level to make sure that there is no recent evidence of diabetes. Body compositions will be measured with 2 established methods: DEXA and whole body bio-impedance spectroscopy (BIS). Fat mass and analysis will be estimated so as to provide a relationship between adiposity, insulin resistance, residual renal function and HDL levels and structure.

clinical_study.why_stopped: insufficient patients with CKD willing to be injected with heparin

primary_outcome.measure: HDL (High Density Lipoprotein) Level in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD 3b, 4, 5) Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: HDL (high density lipoprotein) (mg/dL) -- this is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: HDL (high-density lipoprotein), is called "good" cholesterol. It binds to cholesterols marked for disposal back to the liver to be digested and disposed by the body. High HDL level may lower your risk for heart disease and stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: LDL Level in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD3b, CKD4, CKD5) Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: LDL (low-density lipoprotein), is a type of cholesterol (fat) circulating in the blood vessels, and can form plaques. High levels of LDL cholesterol may raise your risk for heart disease and stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: C Reactive Protein (CRP) Level in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD3b, CKD4, CKD5) Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein (CRP) is an inflammation marker produced by the liver. An increase in CRP value may means inflammation in the body.

primary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI) in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD3b, CKD4, CKD5) Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) is calculated from subject's weight (kilogram) and height (meter)

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin Level in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD3b, CKD4, CKD5) Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: Insulin is a hormone made by the pancreas that allows the body to use or store sugar (glucose) from the food eaten. Insulin regulates blood sugar level.

primary_outcome.measure: LCAT Activity (Lecithin-Cholesterol Acyltransferase) in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease Groups, Mainly to CKD3b, CKD4
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: LCAT measures phospholipase activity in plasma. Measuring LCAT activity may be useful in clarifying the aspects of lipid metabolism in relation to reverse cholesterol transport No data collected- no standard deviation calculated

primary_outcome.measure: CETP Activity (Lecithin-Cholesterol Acyltransferase) in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease Groups, Mainly to CKD3b, CKD4
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is a cross sectional study; only one measurement collected, termed "baseline"
primary_outcome.description: CETP activity measures the transfers of neutral lipids from high density lipoproteins (HDL) to very low density lipoprotein (VLDL) and low density lipoprotein (LDL). CETP may give us the other clue to lipoprotein metabolism and reverse cholesterol transport pathway No data collected- no standard deviation calculated

arm_group.description: heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight having glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of greater than 60
heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight having glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of 30-45
heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight having glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of 15-30
heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight having glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of less than 15, or on hemodialysis

intervention.description: This is not an interventional study. The investigators use heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight to release enzyme lipoprotein lipase (LPL) from the body. LPL level will be used as part of calculation of lipid analysis and measurements

biospec_descr.textblock: whole blood taken separated into plasma, serum, and red cells

study_pop.textblock: This is a single center cross sectional study of renal failure in comparison to control subjects. This is not a treatment or outcome trial.

results_reference.citation: Molfino A, Don BR, Kaysen GA. Comparison of bioimpedance and dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry for measurement of fat mass in hemodialysis patients. Nephron Clin Pract. 2012;122(3-4):127-33. doi: 10.1159/000350817. Epub 2013 May 9.

patient_data.ipd_description: once published; data will be shared
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: once published; data will be shared
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: once published; data will be shared

study_doc.doc_comment: for a copy of Approved Consent Form-please contact Study Coordinator -Tjien Dwyer at tlthio@ucdavis.edu

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects are recruited from Sacramento areas within 50 miles radius, and University of California, Davis. Subjects of chronic kidney disease (CKD5) are recruited mainly from five DCI (Dialysis Clinic Incorporation) clinics in Sacramento area.

outcome.description: HDL (high-density lipoprotein), is called "good" cholesterol. It binds to cholesterols marked for disposal back to the liver to be digested and disposed by the body. High HDL level may lower your risk for heart disease and stroke.

group.description: Subject has glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of greater than 60 cc/min -- indication of normal kidney

group.title: Chronic Kidney Disease, Stage 5 (CKD5)
group.description: Subject has glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of less than 15 cc/min - all subjects are on kidney dialysis

group.title: Chronic Kidney Disease 4 (CKD4)
group.description: Subject has glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of 15-29 cc/min

group.title: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3b (CKD 3b)
group.description: Subject has glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of 30-45 cc/min

outcome.title: LCAT Activity (Lecithin-Cholesterol Acyltransferase) in Control and Chronic Kidney Disease Groups, Mainly to CKD3b, CKD4
outcome.description: LCAT measures phospholipase activity in plasma. Measuring LCAT activity may be useful in clarifying the aspects of lipid metabolism in relation to reverse cholesterol transport No data collected- no standard deviation calculated

reported_events.desc: This is not an interventional study. No adverse event monitored.

group.title: Control
group.description: heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight having glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of greater than 60 Heparin: This is not an interventional study. The investigators use heparin at 50unit/kg of body weight to release enzyme lipoprotein lipase (LPL) from the body. LPL level will be used as part of calculation of lipid analysis and measurements

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Early termination of study due to low number of enrollment in chronic kidney disease group 3b and 4. Secondly, chronic kidney disease subjects prefer not to receive heparin. Heparin is necessary for our study.
